abstract: Shares of Bank of America climbed on Wednesday after its chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, said he thought the bank could pay back its $45 billion in government bailout money by early next year if the recession eased.
lead_paragraph: Shares of Bank of America climbed on Wednesday after its chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, said he thought the bank could pay back its $45 billion in government bailout money by early next year if the recession eased.

headline.main: BofA’s Stock Jumps as Lewis Ponders TARP Payback
